programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy returns to help beleaguered owners tame their boisterous felines. He meets skydiver Jacques, who owns two ferocious Savannah cats, and Bijan and Heather, who are being driven apart by the territorial Wolfie

programme.title: The Dark Side of the Sun
programme.desc: Scientists have only recently begun to understand the true nature of our ‘local star, the Sun. This program discusses its past and future, and its effect on our planet

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The Texas Game Wardens are called when a nuisance alligator gets too close for comfort, while a suburban squirrel hunter is caught trespassing

programme.title: Wild Mexico
programme.desc: A profile of the North American country, an ancient land full of diversity and mystery, and home to a vast wilderness of oceans, deserts, jungle and unique creatures

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and his team are faced with saving a dog that goes into cardiac arrest shortly after arriving at the clinic

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: More fly-on-the-wall action following day-to-day life in the Villalobos Rescue Centre. Tia Torres packs up her family, the parolees and her pit bulls to move the operations centre across the country to New Orleans in Louisiana

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia meets a family of eight looking to adopt a new dog after losing their previous pooch to cancer. Plus, a rescue-call takes mother and daughter into New Orleanss infamous ninth ward

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy this week comes to the aid of felines Littlez and Whiskey, whose troublesome temperaments need reining in

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy investigates the behaviour of cat Einstein, which is mild until it sees fellow feline Izzy - and then goes on the attack. Plus, an expectant couple worry about their pets mood swings

programme.title: Megalodon: The Monster Shark Lives
programme.desc: Documentary seeking evidence of the existence of a massive prehistoric shark, which would have been the largest predatory marine creature ever. The film aims to identify if such a monster might have died out 200 million years ago, and if not, whether it still stalks the uncharted depths of the ocean

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: The science behind amazing animal facts, including how a lizard can walk on water. Plus, the question of whether jellyfish live for ever

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: A bird expert reveals how a barn owl catches prey it cannot even see. Plus, what makes octopuses masters of disguise

programme.title: Extinct or Alive
programme.desc: Wildlife biologist Forrest Gallante scours the globe using cutting-edge technology on his mission to find species that the world has stopped looking for

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.sub-title: A Sea Lion Pup Grows Up
programme.desc: The zookeepers face unexpected setbacks weaning a bright sea lion pup off her mothers milk, and are also forced to step in to support a rejected curassow chick

programme.title: Surviving Joe Exotic
programme.desc: Joe Exotic gives one of his last interviews before his arrest. Plus, ex-employees reveal the truth about his infamous zoo, and there is a look at the rescue of some of its big cats

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Alaskan family the Kilchers struggle through a record-breaking harsh winter, and Atz, Lee and Jane search for food

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the University of Pennsylvania School of Veterinary Medicine. School is in full swing and in just a few months the students will be doctors - but first they must first pass their final rotations

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: Tensions are high throughout the Pennsylvania veterinary school as the day arrives when the fourth-year students find out whether they have been matched to an internship programme

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: Deep in the Alaskan bush lives a family who was born and raised wild. Billy and Amy Brown and their children live off the grid and rely on each other to survive

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Steve Irwins family at Australia Zoo. After months of training with Steves best friend Wes, son Robert is ready to solo feed Graham, the zoos most notorious crocodile

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The Texas Game Wardens go undercover to catch someone selling illegal alligator parts. A tip-off leads to an angler with multiple undersized fish

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A dog is brought into the clinic with a suspected broken leg but Dr Jeff quickly diagnoses a far more serious condition. A cats appetite gets it in trouble

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A micro-pig with an injured leg requires surgery, but anaesthesia could be deadly, while a French bulldogs routine dental exam becomes a complex operation

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Tia Maria Torres is called upon to help when an elusive pit bull is saved from drowning and finds herself having to take on another parolee when 20 new puppies arrive

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: A request for help takes a tragic turn when Tia helps a man care for two dogs he rescued. Meanwhile, a volunteer at Villalobos steps up to adopt a canine with an unusual past

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy examines and tries to tame aggressive cat Symone, which launches into an attack whenever it hears owner Kelly laughing or crying

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps newly-married couple John and Samantha. The pair are having trouble taming the latters cat, Puma, which seems resentful of John in particular

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson and the team build a charming treehouse in the style of a rustic river shack along the banks of the Mississippi

programme.title: Bad Dog!
programme.desc: Footage of naughty animals that cause their owners grief, including a cat that knocks over a Christmas tree and a dog that ends up inside a toaster oven

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.sub-title: Backwards Birds and Slimy Sea Creatures
programme.desc: High-speed footage reveals how the hummingbird can fly backwards, and a look at the hagfish, which is unlikely to win any underwater beauty contests

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.sub-title: Puppy Dog Tails and Crocodile Jaws
programme.desc: What a dog is saying when it wags its tail, and the secret behind a crocodiles powerful jaws - and how to escape it

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Documentary following teams coming to the aid of distressed or missing felines. Shaun heads out on a solo night mission to rescue an animal that has been missing three weeks, and joins Tom in an attempt to rescue a feral cat

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun and Tom investigate whether a stranded cat is really who its owner says it is. There is also an attempt to reunite a feline with its canine companion

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Max, a beloved camel, develops a large abscess on his head. A marmot prepares for its first classroom visit as an ambassador animal

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Brett Raymer and Wayde King return for more tank-building projects, as they look to construct a giant aquarium for the owners of Creek Casino. The undertaking marks ATMs 10,000th tank and is one of the largest the pair have built

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Atz and the family head out on a black bear hunt, and Janes confidence grows. Meanwhile, Otto tries to save the lives of two prematurely born calves

programme.title: Fish or Die
programme.desc: Four friends and die-hard anglers set out to be the first to fish the most remote waters in the world. They begin with a gruelling jungle expedition to investigate rumours of a golden dorado, a large predatory fish, following migrating baitfish up an uncharted Bolivian river

programme.title: Shark Vortex
programme.desc: Greg Skomal and Joe Remeiro study an annual summer event in which the Gulf Stream pushes north into the waters of southern New England, bringing with it 30 species of shark

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns begin an ambitious barn build, the key to Billys grand vision. Plus, Noah returns, reuniting the entire wolfpack for the first time since Alaska

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Documentary following teams coming to the aid of distressed or missing felines. Shaun heads out on a solo night mission to rescue an animal that has been missing three weeks, and joins Tom in an attempt to rescue a feral cat

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun and Tom investigate whether a stranded cat is really who its owner says it is. There is also an attempt to reunite a feline with its canine companion

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: Max, a beloved camel, develops a large abscess on his head. A marmot prepares for its first classroom visit as an ambassador animal

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried decides it is time the practices image moved with the times. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Tragedy mars a birthday celebration, while a late-night drink leaves James and Siegfried facing the long arm of the law. Rural drama, guest starring Dorothy Tutin, with Robert Hardy and Christopher Timothy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James takes part in the annual village cricket match, where the already legendary Freddie Trueman is one of the captains, and Siegfried offers solace when a goldfish dies. Rural drama, with Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Civil servants Harcourt and Pendleton back Cravens attempts to discover why Emma broke into the Northmoor nuclear plant, and before long a man he once jailed is implicated in her murder. Meanwhile, CIA agent Darius Jedburgh presses ahead with his own investigation

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Craven hacks into MI5s computer database and discovers a route into the Northmoor nuclear plant, while the President orders Jedburgh to get proof of Grogans illegal activities - by stealing his plutonium. Bob Peck and Joe Don Baker star in Troy Kennedy-Martins award-winning political thriller

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.desc: Michael Parkinson looks back at a 1974 interview with the actor, who at the time was battling against alcoholism and had just spent six weeks in hospital for treatment. Parkinson persuaded him to talk candidly about his career, love life and drink problems

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo has a burglar alarm installed, but Tom and Barbara claim they have nothing left worth stealing. Jerry is convinced he has failed to succeed his boss as head of the firm, and the Goods decide that despite all their problems, they are glad they became self-sufficient. Seventies comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Richard Briers

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: A territorial battle develops in the corridors of power. Sir Humphrey has skilfully moved the PMs political adviser Dorothy Wainwright out of her office - but she insists on moving back. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried decides it is time the practices image moved with the times. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Lynda Bellingham

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Tragedy mars a birthday celebration, while a late-night drink leaves James and Siegfried facing the long arm of the law. Rural drama, guest starring Dorothy Tutin, with Robert Hardy and Christopher Timothy

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James takes part in the annual village cricket match, where the already legendary Freddie Trueman is one of the captains, and Siegfried offers solace when a goldfish dies. Rural drama, with Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.desc: The steeplejack takes a look at the extraordinary expansion of industrial Britain in the 18th and 19th centuries, and the continued use of huge steam engines in collieries, steelworks and mills in the 20th century

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the hidden villages of London. Despite many rural settlements like Hornsey and Dagenham being swallowed up by the expansion of London, Hampstead residents successfully fought to preserve their village heritage, while in recent years Londoners have created a new breed of urban villages like Crouch End and Walthamstow

programme.title: Dance Passion Bradford
programme.desc: Dancers of all kinds take over the streets, theatres and surrounding countryside to showcase Bradford and celebrate the joy of dance during its UK City of Culture year. The performances feature solos, duets and ensembles in a variety of styles, including ballet, disco, bhangra, kathak, contemporary and street, as well as artistic swimming, with companies taking part including the Royal Ballet, Northern Ballet, Northern School of Contemporary Dance, Punjabi Roots, Dance United Yorkshire, Birmingham Royal Ballet, Akram Khan Dance Company, Pagrav, Rhythmosaic, Ella Tighe Dance and the City of Bradford Artistic Swimmers.

programme.title: Matthew Bourne Remembers - Swan Lake
programme.desc: The highly acclaimed choreographer and director discusses his groundbreaking 1995 reinterpretation of Swan Lake, a production that revolutionised modern ballet by replacing the traditional female swans with a male ensemble. Thirty years on, Bourne reflects on the challenges of reimagining a classic and the reaction at the time, and talks about the creative journey behind the shows enduring success, and its cultural impact over the past three decades

programme.title: Matthew Bournes Swan Lake
programme.desc: Life for a prince is lonely as he carries out his regal duties and watches his mother the Queen flirt with her handsome courtiers, while she also dislikes his girlfriend. An all-male corps de ballet features in choreographer Matthew Bournes contemporary dance performance, loosely based on Tchaikovskys ballet, at Sadlers Wells Theatre in London. First broadcast in 1996

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith looks at the influence of John Maynard Keynes, who drew the blueprint for the postwar economic boom, and recalls his own involvement in those momentous years

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith visits the ruins of postwar Berlin and the corridors of power in the Pentagon in his assessment of the contemporary roots of war

programme.title: Dance Passion Bradford
programme.desc: Dancers of all kinds take over the streets, theatres and surrounding countryside to showcase Bradford and celebrate the joy of dance during its UK City of Culture year. The performances feature solos, duets and ensembles in a variety of styles, including ballet, disco, bhangra, kathak, contemporary and street, as well as artistic swimming, with companies taking part including the Royal Ballet, Northern Ballet, Northern School of Contemporary Dance, Punjabi Roots, Dance United Yorkshire, Birmingham Royal Ballet, Akram Khan Dance Company, Pagrav, Rhythmosaic, Ella Tighe Dance and the City of Bradford Artistic Swimmers.

Despite many rural settlements like Hornsey and Dagenham being swallowed up by the expansion of London, Hampstead residents successfully fought to preserve their village heritage, while in recent years Londoners have created a new breed of urban villages like Crouch End and Walthamstow

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by Sam Holland, Jeremy Lee and Crystelle Pereira, as well as Celebrity Traitors star Joe Marler. Olly Smith picks the drinks to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: The Lady Mayors Show 2025
programme.desc: Katie Derham presents coverage of the civic parade in the City of London, celebrating the appointment of Susan Langley. Tina Daheley catches up with participants on the ground. Featuring an appearance by the hydroplane Bluebird K7 alongside the Pearly Kings and Queens

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekends matches, including Manchester City v Liverpool. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and Richard Madley assist the teams in Oswestry, Shropshire, while Christina Trevanion visits the costume department at the Royal Shakespeare Company

programme.title: Live International Rugby League
programme.desc: England v Australia (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the third and final match of the Ashes series, which takes place at AMT Headingley Stadium in Leeds. This is the first meeting between the sides at this ground since 1975, when England claimed a 12-0 win, but the Kangaroos thrashed Great Britain 44-4 on their last visit to the venue in 2004

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoons news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Richie Anderson, Tasha Ghouri, JB Gill, Una Healy, Tamzin Outhwaite and Nina Wadia are paired with six contestants hoping to outwit each other to win big in the celebrity version of the quiz show, hosted by Amanda Holden

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: The couples show off another routine in a bid to impress judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke, as well as the viewers, in the hope of avoiding the fate of last weeks eliminated couple Ellie and Vito. Theyll be working hard to stay as far away from the bottom of the leaderboard as possible - but as the series has proved, thats no guarantee of avoiding the dance off. Presented by Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the quiz show with the giant spinning wheel, with Ed Gamble, Jonathan Ross, Liz Bonnin, the Rev Richard Coles, Jo Brand, Francis Bourgeois and AJ Odudu advising the contestants as they answer their way to a fortune

programme.title: Royal British Legion Festival of Remembrance 2025
programme.desc: The annual commemorative performance from the Royal Albert Hall, featuring performances from Rod Stewart, Blessing Offor, Sam Ryder, Keala Settle and the Wellermen, as well as the Central Band of the RAF, the RAF Squadronaires, the Kings Colour Squadron, and The Band of HM Royal Marines. The Festival will commemorate both the 80th anniversary of the end of the Second World War and the 25th anniversary of the UK Government lifting the ban on gay, lesbian, and bisexual personnel serving openly in the armed forces

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium and Sunderland v Arsenal at Stadium of Light. Spurs were looking for another victory over United after defeating them four times last season, including in the UEFA Europa League final. The Gunners are aiming to go one better than in each of the last three seasons and win the title, but faced a test of their credentials against the Black Cats, who had made an impressive start to the campaign. Plus, Everton v Fulham, West Ham United v Burnley and Chelsea v Wolverhampton Wanderers

programme.title: The Football Interview
programme.desc: Kelly Somers talks to USA manager Emma Hayes, who previously guided Chelsea to seven FA Womens Super League titles

programme.title: The Mercy
programme.desc: The story of amateur sailor Donald Crowhurst and his solo attempt to circumnavigate the globe in 1968. The struggles he confronted on the controversial voyage, while his family awaited his return, is one of the most enduring mysteries of recent times. Factual drama, starring Colin Firth, David Thewlis and Rachel Weisz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

Spurs were looking for another victory over United after defeating them four times last season, including in the UEFA Europa League final. The Gunners are aiming to go one better than in each of the last three seasons and win the title, but faced a test of their credentials against the Black Cats, who had made an impressive start to the campaign. Plus, Everton v Fulham, West Ham United v Burnley and Chelsea v Wolverhampton Wanderers

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Remembrance Sunday
programme.desc: Sophie Raworth and Petroc Trelawny present live coverage from London as the King leads the Remembrance Sunday commemorations at the Cenotaph. The King will be joined on Whitehall by senior members of the Royal Family and leading UK politicians, alongside the armed forces, representatives of the Commonwealth, and faith communities, for the two minute silence at 11 oclock and the National Service of Remembrance

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers looks at the political developments of the week and questions policy makers on the key issues.

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Aldershot Garrison, known as the home of the British Army, to mark Remembrance Sunday and to hear stories of faith, courage and thanksgiving. At the Cathedral Church of St Michael and St George, Aled meets Colonel Dave Kenny, an Army leader with over 30 years of service. Together they explore the cathedrals meaning as a sanctuary for soldiers and families and discuss how Remembrance honours both those lost in conflict and those still affected after returning home

programme.title: Chronicles of the Sperrins
programme.desc: At Gaelcholáiste Dhoire, an Irish language post primary school, hurling coach Cian is preparing the U15 school team for the local derby final. Storm Darragh brings widespread chaos to the region

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin reveals hidden wildlife gems to be found in winter, travelling from the frozen Highlands of Scotland down to the quiet suburbs of Sussex. He goes in search of a bird that turns white to blend in with the snow and wild boars that have returned to Britains forests for the first time in 700 years, and climbs a three-metre-tall scaffold tower to get footage of wild tawny owls

programme.title: Kensukes Kingdom
programme.desc: A boy and his dog are washed overboard from their boat, leaving them stranded on a Pacific island. The youngster finds support from a fellow castaway, who helps him to protect the fragile home he has built for himself. Animated adventure based on Michael Morpurgos novel, featuring the voices of Aaron MacGregor, Sally Hawkins, Cillian Murphy, Raffey Cassidy and Ken Watanabe

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.sub-title: Vegetable Harvest: A Very Tough Year
programme.desc: John Craven and Charlotte Smith visit Lincolnshire at the height of harvest, where high temperatures in summer have led to one of the worst yields in recent years. Plus, Adam Henson meets the three finalists competing for the title of Young Countryside Champion at this years BBC Food and Farming Awards

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Documentary about four rival families - leopards, hyenas, wild dogs and lions - trying to claim a rich corner of Zambia as their home. Leopard mother Olimbas world is turned upside down by the arrival of Wild Dog Storm and her chaotic pack. But just when the dogs are beginning to settle into the Kingdom and welcome a litter of puppies, an even more powerful force appears on the horizon - lions. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman announce the results of the judges scores and viewers votes, with the two lowest-scoring couples taking part in the dance-off. James Morrison provides the music and the professionals perform a routine for Remembrance Sunday, accompanied by the Band of the R oyal Air Force Regiment

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Lister Park and Cartwright Hall in Bradford, where treasures include life-sized ventriloquist dummies, a framed advert incorporating Mae Wests hair, and albums of rare Indian art bought for £5 in a Dublin flea-market. Fiona also looks into the history of Cartwright Hall, tracing it back to Bradfords Great Exhibition of 1904

programme.title: Riot Women
programme.desc: While Kitty spends the night in police custody with a broken hand, Beth and Tom have a tragic, terminal conversation about her. Jess has a massive hangover and forgets what she agreed to the night before. Holly visits Nisha in hospital and gets an exciting offer - but there may not be enough good will left among the band to take it up

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Liverpool at Etihad Stadium and Crystal Palace v Brighton and Hove Albion at Selhurst Park. One of City or Liverpool have won the league in each of the past eight seasons, but both teams have lost a number of games already this term. Palace beat their rivals Brighton home and away last term, but a closely fought encounter was anticipated. Plus, Aston Villa v Bournemouth, Brentford v Newcastle United and Nottingham Forest v Leeds United

programme.title: The Womens Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekends matches in the Super League, including Arsenal v Chelsea, Manchester United v Aston Villa and Everton v Manchester City

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Hollywood star Glen Powell who is appearing in dystopian action thriller The Running Man. Also on the sofa are Oscar-winner Michelle Yeoh, who is playing Madame Morrible in Wicked: For Good, Emmy-winning Brit Rosamund Pike, currently in crime caper sequel Now You See Me: Now You Dont and comedian-actor Jack Whitehall, one of the stars of tense thriller series Malice. Plus, Ed Sheeran chats and performs Camera, from his current album Play

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctor Who Confidential
programme.desc: How the crew of Doctor Who re-created 19th-century France in the Croatian town of Trojir, where The Vampires of Venice was also filmed. Plus, actor Tony Curran explores the work of Vincent Van Gogh at the J Paul Getty Museum in Los Angeles, which houses one of his most valuable paintings. Narrated by Alex Price

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord and Amy travel to 19th-century Provence, where they join forces with Vincent Van Gogh to battle an invisible alien only the artist can see. As well as combating the terrors that lurk in the cornfields, they try to restore the tormented painters happiness. Written by Richard Curtis (Love Actually) and guest starring Tony Curran (This Life) and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an Essex wife - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Gemma bumps into an old flame and realises she still has feelings for him. She introduces him to Malcolm, who tries to impress him. Malcolm tries to retrieve his belongings that Davina had left in the loft when she sold the old family home, but the new owners refuse to let him in. Derek hatches a plan for Malcolm to break into the house and retrieve his stuff. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey and Sherrie Hewson

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Malcolm and Derek throw Gemma a baby shower. Derek surprises Malcolm with an escape room for his birthday, where they are kidnapped off the street. However, the duo later get locked within it. Xander discovers Gemma in labour and unable to contact Malcolm, and with no one else available to be her birthing partner, Xander has to step in. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood and David Morrissey

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Louise meets her dad for the first time, but he shows more interest in Jonny than in her. Donna gives Gaz an answer to his marriage proposal and Janet comes up with a new way of supporting her child - which is not strictly legal

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: After being chatted up by Louises father, Jonny resolves to become more macho but things dont go as planned. Donna refuses to have a baby with Gaz, leaving him with only one option for getting the child he so desperately wants

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Donna regrets persuading Gaz to try tantric sex when he gets hooked on it, while Louise wants a new family and seems to know exactly where to find one. Jonny gets a job as a farmer and Janet increases her home security

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Gemma bumps into an old flame and realises she still has feelings for him. She introduces him to Malcolm, who tries to impress him. Malcolm tries to retrieve his belongings that Davina had left in the loft when she sold the old family home, but the new owners refuse to let him in. Derek hatches a plan for Malcolm to break into the house and retrieve his stuff. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey and Sherrie Hewson

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Malcolm and Derek throw Gemma a baby shower. Derek surprises Malcolm with an escape room for his birthday, where they are kidnapped off the street. However, the duo later get locked within it. Xander discovers Gemma in labour and unable to contact Malcolm, and with no one else available to be her birthing partner, Xander has to step in. Comedy, starring Aimee Lou Wood and David Morrissey

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat does her best to support Zoe, Eve is nervous as she and Suki welcome Eves mum, Norma, to Walford, and when Phil returns to Albert Square he is furious to learn about Nigels situation

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Teddy tells George and Junior the truth about whats been going on at Kojos flat, and as Zoe reels from her discovery, Kat is determined to help her daughter and decides to sell her share of the limo business to Harvey

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Eve tells Suki she doesnt want to go ahead with the adoption, Zoe pleads with Kat as she insists she was only responsible for the defaced photos, and Phil and Julie accompany Nigel to his medical assessment in relation to being charged for the accident

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat orchestrates a meeting with Zoe and Anthony as she worries about her daughters welfare, Nicola tries to build bridges with George, and Patrick and Kim grow suspicious of Anthonys clandestine behaviour

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the ultimate game of deception and trust draws to a close, the stakes have never been higher as the celebrity players face their final, explosive mission. programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: All the finalists join Ed Gamble for their first interviews in front of a studio audience. Claudia Winkleman also reflects on the first UK celebrity series

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers the dark side of Thailands backpacker culture. In the first episode, she lands in trouble with the Thai police when she starts to uncover the scale of Thailands illegal sex industry. A visit to the Bangkok Immigration Detention Centre exposes how easy it is to get caught on the wrong side of the law

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets men chasing cheap thrills in Asias sex capital, Pattaya, and also talks to a local sex worker, who reveals the harsh reality of working in the illegal sex industry. She then heads to Ko Phangan, an exotic island famed for its spirituality and beauty. For Zara, this is paradise - but Lucio, a Brit who built a burgeoning cannabis business here while the drug was decriminalised, reveals that navigating the local law isnt always easy

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: Zara McDermott experiences Ko Phangans famous Full Moon Party, but beneath the cheap cocktails, music and fire shows, theres danger lurking as the medical team treat a possible drink-spiking victim. She then travels to Phuket and experiences a taste of Thailands luxury lifestyle. But she also learns how dream holidays can quickly go wrong, hearing the case of a British holiday-maker who died on the island - and whose family is still searching for answers

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Very average woman Spud cooks, cleans, serves and cares for her father. The only problem is she does it all rather badly - and half-heartedly. A woman who is never seen, unattractive and ignored, she does not feel bad about herself. However, when her father dies, she starts to realise she may have to come out from the shadow and be seen. Comedy drama, written by and starring Siobhán McSweeney

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. After a video featuring a female prison officer and an inmate having sex inside HMP Wandsworth goes viral, journalist Mobeen Azhar begins an investigation into what happened and why. A year of twists, turns and damning revelations pulls back the curtain on a dangerous wider world of coercion, corruption and contraband thriving behind bars

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mobeen Azhars investigation into prison corruption uncovers the murder of a former officer who had been involved in exposing an illicit relationship. programme.title: Football Fantastics

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Diellzas family comes from Kosovo. She makes a traditional recipe of stuffed peppers. Diellza has lovely colourful ingredients for her stuffed peppers such as spring onions, sweetcorn, grated carrot. She also uses cooked rice, chopped tomatoes, parsley, garlic puree and paprika for seasoning. This yummy filling is stuffed into her peppers and placed in the oven to be cooked for her friends. To accompany her meal, Diellza serves her friends a traditional Kosovan drink made of yoghurt and water called kos. Will they enjoy her drink, and will they guess what the special ingredient is?

programme.title: My First Festivals

programme.title: Octonauts

programme.title: Biff and Chip
programme.desc: Biff, Chip and Kipper are very excited to be looking after Sticky, the school stick insect, for the whole weekend. In fact the only person who isnt excited is Dad, who is scared of insects and tells the children not to let Sticky out of his tank. But when Biff and Chip race downstairs the following day to say hello to Sticky, they find the tank is empty and Sticky has escaped! Now what will they do? Anneena comes to visit and joins the hunt for Sticky. Sometimes to find a stick insect, you have to think like a stick insect. Can the children find Sticky before Dad realises he is missing?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is fed up with the price of movies, so he starts illegally downloading films and opens his own cinema in the back yard. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Comic Book Guy hasnt had much luck with the ladies in the past but all that changes when he takes advice from Marvel Comics head honcho Stan Lee, who gives him the courage to ask out a Japanese manga artist - and what woman wouldnt be wowed by a bouquet of flowers delivered in a Hulk hand?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: Restaurateurs compete in and around Glasgow. First up is music venue-cum-restaurant Bloc, where head chef Andy and front of house Pixie serve up a feast of street food. Day two sees husband-and-wife team Luca and Magda of Italian restaurant Amore dItalia pulling out all the stops, serving a Sicilian menu with a Scottish twist. Finally, confident duo Teddy and Michael of sushi and noodle soup chain Maki set out to impress

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Cumbria couple Samantha and Sam want to find their dream holiday home in Spain that works for them and their teenage sons. They know Spain well but have never been to Oliva, so theyre placing all their trust in Lee Juggurnauth to find the perfect home at the right place for them. With a budget of £85,000, the pair hop Lee can deliver their Spanish dream

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George follows more of the most eccentric, ambitious and passionate self-builders hes ever met. He also attempts to create an elegant airborne cabin from an old industrial scissor lift and heads to Denmark, home of gorgeous and minimalist architecture. In this episode, a young couple challenge themselves to fit a camper on the back of a tiny Italian Tuk-Tuk, and a father of two boys creates a quirky getaway in an abandoned nuclear bunker. Meanwhile, George and Will Hardie create lightweight furniture for their sky cabin, with mixed results

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help first-time buyers from Manchester. Robyn and Alice are struggling to decide between a starter flat and classic Corrie-style redbrick home. Steph and Christopher have been outbid 10 times even though theyve bid as much as £50,000 over asking price

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer step into the middle of a domestic deadlock in Wolverhampton. Gordon, Suky and their three children live in a four-bedroom home that they bought in 2011, lured by the promise of an indoor pool - but while that feature may still be making a splash, the rest of the house is sinking fast. Suky is desperate to escape as she loathes the gloomy interiors, the severe lack of storage and the claustrophobic, isolating kitchen. On the other hand, Gordon is firmly anchored, convinced that with a little help from Kirstie, their house could become the perfect family home

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The three finalists bake a classic British iced bun in the signature, a tower of French delights in the technical and for their showstopper take on the challenge of making the largest ever cake in Bake Off history. As ever, Alison Hammond and Noel Fielding encourage the bakers, while judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith taste their efforts - but only one can be crowned winner of The Great British Bake Off 2025

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Bettany Hughes Treasures of the World
programme.desc: On a journey across the Greek island of Rhodes, Bettany visits a remote ancient settlement in the mountains, home to a vast necropolis and acropolis with over 500 tombs dating back to the 7th century BCE. She also examines the impact of the Knights of St John, a military monastic order that transformed Rhodes into a medieval stronghold, attends a traditional carnival, and visits the oldest in Greece

programme.title: Titanic: Secrets of the Shipwreck
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of how the doomed ocean liners wreckage was discovered in 1985 by a team of US and French scientists and explorers. The first episode recounts several unsuccessful attempts to locate the wreck before Texan oil billionaire Jack Grimm used his money to fund the latest sonar and camera technology to attempt to find the ship

programme.title: Titanic: Secrets of the Shipwreck
programme.desc: Part two of two. Scientist and explorer Robert Ballard uses the cover of US Navy missions looking for lost nuclear submarines to seek out the wreck. The team join forces with French researchers and their cutting-edge tech to scour the ocean floor. Eventually part of the wreck is spotted, and the mysteries of the Titanic are uncovered

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.sub-title: Formula 1 Sao Paulo Grand Prix Sprint Race And Qualifying Highlights

With analysis from Mark Webber

programme.title: T2 Trainspotting
programme.desc: Recovering heroin addict Mark Renton returns to his Edinburgh roots after 20 years living overseas, hoping to make peace with the friends he abandoned. However, starting anew proves far from easy, especially when old partner in crime Begbie escapes from prison, still brooding on Rentons betrayal. Danny Boyles drama sequel, starring Ewan McGregor, Robert Carlyle, Ewen Bremner and Jonny Lee Miller

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to Charlies Italian bistro in La Verne, southern California, where the owners lack of business nous is putting her relatives homes at risk, after her mother and sister put them up as collateral. To make matters worse, the restaurants food is less than appetising and its long-serving chef seems to be incompetent

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Joe Lycett explores how to get the most out of a weekend away with a fun-packed, 48-hour itinerary of trademark humour and facts. This time, fellow comedian Sarah Millican joins him for an exploration of the Lithuanian capital Vilnius. The duo take to the skies to see the city from above - an experience they find by turns terrifying, thrilling and beautiful. Keen to explore Lithuanian cuisine, they sample cold beetroot soup and cepelini dumplings washed down with gira, a drink made from fermented beer. Later, the pair explore Vilnius medieval centre on foot, taking in Gediminass tower and Lukiskes Prison

programme.title: Car S.O.S.

Sadly, the dream was shattered when Alison was killed in the Manchester Arena bombing in 2017. Former England footballers Bryan Robson and Wes Brown join in to help restore the fortunes of a family torn apart by tragic events

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It

programme.title: Sarah Beenys New Life in the Country

Sarah realises that she cant carry on working in random parts of the house, so comes up with a plan to seamlessly weave her workspace into the living area

Worlds apart, Cushla knows a relationship like this spells all kinds of trouble, but they are irresistibly drawn to each other. In a place where loose lips cost lives and danger lurks in the shadows, amid the fear and paranoia, this illicit affair between the pair ignites and burns bright. programme.title: The Big Snow of 47
programme.desc: Houses buried under snow, rivers frozen solid, bombers called upon to drop bread to isolated villages. How did Brits survive the snowiest winter ever recorded? Less than two years after the Second World War ended, with food strictly rationed and most homes without central heating, the nation shivered for seven long weeks in a Siberian climate. Huge snow drifts and plunging temperatures of -21C caused frozen railways, factory shutdowns, power cuts and a farming crisis. Famous faces including John Craven, Amanda Barrie, Timothy West and Neil Kinnock share childhood memories of the extreme winter and explain why it remains unparalleled

programme.title: The Jobless Prince: What Will Harry Do Next?
programme.desc: A team of experts featuring PR specialists, businesspeople, life coaches and royal insiders looks at what the future holds for the Duke of Sussex, with his ties to the royal family being strained and his public image polarising opinion. They explore what his real passions and skills are, and examine whether he can learn from the examples of other members of the royal family and whose playbook should he avoid following

programme.title: Meghan and Harry: Where Did the Money Go?
programme.desc: For nearly a decade, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have captured the worlds attention like no other couple, relentlessly splashed across tabloid covers. But beyond the glitz and glamour, questions swirl around their finances and how they make their money remains a deep mystery. This programme looks at how they have maintained their lavish lifestyle after leaving the royal familys purse strings behind

programme.title: When TV Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Fern Britton narrates a selection of TVs most memorable guests, whether theyre suffering a slip of the tongue, a technical meltdown or having a bust-up. Featuring less-than-perfect appearances by Piers Morgan, Jonathan Ross, Stormzy, Shirley Bassey, Bez, Lembit Opik and Kathy Burke. Contributors include presenters Richard Arnold, Lucrezia Millarini, James Whale and Stephen Bailey.

programme.title: 1000 Years a Slave
programme.desc: Famous people with direct links to the slave trade go on journeys around the globe to document their connections to it and examine how it shaped the modern world. In the first episode, actors David Harewood and Hugh Quarshie explore opposite sides of the Atlantic slave trade, which saw an estimated 12 million Africans transported across the ocean and sold into a life of slavery

programme.title: Natural History Museum: World of Wonder
programme.desc: World-leading dinosaur expert Susie Maidment is in the museum basement trying to piece together the skeleton of the first Tyrannosaurus rex ever discovered. The experts inspect Guy the gorilla, who was a London Zoo favourite for decades and now sits fully preserved in his own glass case, and the museum launches an ambitious project to capture a sample of every living bug in the UK today

programme.title: The Greatest TV of the...
programme.desc: The best programmes of the decade, featuring archive clips from shows including The Tube, The Young Ones, Brookside, EastEnders, Dallas, Dynasty and Blind Date. Michael Buerk speaks about his 1984 news report on the Ethiopian famine, while Coronation Street star William Roache remembers the storyline that saw Ken Barlow in a love triangle with wife Deirdre and arch enemy Mike Baldwin. programme.title: 1986: Most Shocking Moments
programme.desc: Controversies, scandals and surprises from the year, with Grange Hill tackling the issue of heroin addiction and EastEnders introducing a gay couple to Albert Square. Screenwriter Dennis Potters drama The Singing Detective won over the critics, but its sex scenes and nudity upset moral campaigner Mary Whitehouse, while cricketer Ian Botham caused a storm after confessing that hed smoked marijuana. Narrated by Jan Leeming, with contributions from Mark Little, Nick Ferrari, Cheryl Baker, Nick Hewer, Danny John-Jules and Nina Wadia

programme.title: Michael McIntyres Big Show

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: An attractive but unqualified man applies for a job as Rachels assistant, placing her in a quandary as she struggles to decide between hiring him or a more competent woman. programme.desc: The remaining couples embark on their final dates, an opportunity for grand gestures and expressions of love

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: While being interviewed for a documentary about Star Trek character Mr Spock, Sheldon struggles to suppress his emotions about his recent break-up with Amy, leaving Leonard and Penny shocked to discover he had bought her an engagement ring. Howard and Bernadette fall out over plans to renovate his childhood home. Wil Wheaton, Adam Nimoy and Stephen Merchant guest star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy has a date with a mystery man, so Sheldon asks Howard and Raj to help him find a new girlfriend online. When Amy is coy with the details about the guy shes dating, Penny and Bernadette decide to spy on them. Stephen Merchant guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the middle of a nationwide shortage of liquid helium, Sheldon and Leonard take desperate measures to obtain the supplies they need in order to prove a scientific theory before a rival team of researchers can beat them to it. Meanwhile, Penny and Bernadette download a dating app onto Amys phone in order to find her a new boyfriend

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Noel Fielding and Sandi Toksvig host a special celebrity edition featuring the cast of Derry Girls for the second of 2020s Christmas specials. Saoirse-Monica Jackson, Nicola Coughlan, Jamie-Lee ODonnell, Dylan Llewellyn and Siobhan McSweeney will be cooking up some New Year-inspired bakes to impress judges Prue Leith and Paul Hollywood and be crowned Star Baker. With music from the London Gospel Community Choir

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is told to entertain a visiting Nigerian princess whose father is in town for a business meeting with Mr Burns, but when she proves uninterested in the TV, he takes her to Moes, where she and the normally irascible barman strike a surprisingly sweet friendship. With the guest voices of Jon Lovitz and Richard Branson

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Chief Wiggum gets his hands on a military jet pack, only to cause insurmountable damage to the local church. To make matters worse, Marge and the rest of the congregation are short of funds to repair their beloved place of worship - so they resort to gambling to raise the necessary funds

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The couples separate for a final boys and girls night out, where they welcome back some old friends, but a shocking revelation sparks one of the most explosive showdowns in the experiments history

programme.title: MAFS UK: Its Official!
programme.sub-title: MAFS UK: Its Official! With Lucinda Light
programme.desc: Dani Dyer joins Lucinda to discuss the drama from the penultimate week, as viewers wait to find out which of the newlyweds will be able to make their marriages work in the real world. Paul C Brunson casts his expert eye over the couples at this crucial moment. Also, Julia-Ruth pops in to talk about her controversial holiday

programme.title: My Best Friends Wedding
programme.desc: A food critic realises she is in love with her best friend just as he announces he is going to marry another woman. Determined to have him to herself, she heads for the wedding with the intention of sabotaging the ceremony - but persuading the groom to give up on his bride-to-be proves harder than expected. Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts, Dermot Mulroney, Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The couples separate for a final boys and girls night out, where they welcome back some old friends, but a shocking revelation sparks one of the most explosive showdowns in the experiments history

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five Married at First Sight UK marvels battle it out to win £1000 for charity. The first host is influencer, uber confident sportswoman and self-taught cook Emma Barnes. She is hoping that her wedding-inspired menu is a match made in heaven for her guests - series nine bride Kristina Goodsell, Kristinas groom, and ex, Kieran Chapman, series eight groom Paul Liba, and self-proclaimed icon Ella Morgan. Emma thinks her starters a showstopper but the cheese doesnt please everyone

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second host, Newcastle lad Kieran Chapman, is hoping to tickle his guests fancy with his clown-themed carnival of delights, despite being a dinner party novice

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ella Morgan hosts a night of a thousand icons party, and shes hoping that her decadent menu will woo her guests and catapult her into the lead

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness fanatic Paul Liba hosts a sports-themed night and challenges his guests to eat their pudding while wearing boxing gloves

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night, Kristina Goodsell hosts an orange party, which Kieran takes too literally when he turns up dressed in a traffic cone, while Ella comes dressed as her nan

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica and Geoff decide to throw a party to prove that they can still have fun, while Beverly presses the school faculty to put together a Fame-themed send-off for the senior class

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates this series exploring extreme behaviour in the natural world, uncovering some of the strategies animals have developed to stay alive and to breed, from Komodo dragons tackling buffalo to the courtship battle of the humpback whale. He begins by focusing on the methods used by creatures such as cheetahs, bottle-nosed dolphins and Venus fly-traps in their fights for survival

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how reptiles and amphibians, including the pebble toad and Jesus Christ lizard, conquer their shortcomings by using tricks and strategies to avoid predators. He also explores how chameleons can achieve a high level of accuracy with their muscle-propelled, extendible tongues, and finds out how a 9ft-long Komodo dragon can bring down a huge water buffalo

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how mammals dominate the planet and survive in extreme habitats. In the Antarctic, a lone Weddell seal wears its teeth down keeping an ice hole open to catch fish for its pup. In warmer climes, the gerbil-like rufous sengi demonstrates impressive speed to avoid reptilian predators, giant bats feast on fruit trees in Zambia and male humpback whales battle for a female

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: The focus turns to fish, the most diverse vertebrates on the planet, made up of more than 28,000 species. Off the coast of South Australia, sea dragons pair up for courtship, engaging in a mirror dance before the eggs are laid on the males tail. Gobies climb up the vertical rocks of Hawaiian waterfalls to access secluded pools at the summit, and flying fish use their elongated pectoral fins to escape from predators. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker settles into his new job as Minister for Administrative Affairs, ably assisted - and hindered - by civil servants Bernard Woolley and Sir Humphrey Appleby. First episode of the comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: The visiting head of an African nation turns out to be an old college pal of Hacker - who promptly sets about trying to offload some British-made oil-rigging gear. Satirical comedy set in the world of Westminster, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Cutbacks to the civil service threaten the permanent secretarys position so Sir Humphrey tries to manipulate Hacker into abandoning his new policy. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hacker is challenged to convince Sir Humphrey that a computer holding vital citizen information could raise concerns about peoples rights to privacy. Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne star

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Hackers latest cost-cutting scheme has won the support of the prime minister - but Sir Humphrey is still determined to undermine it. Satirical comedy, starring Paul Eddington. First broadcast in 1980

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker believes he needs to know everything going on in his department, and is furious to learn Sir Humphrey is withholding information. However, when events take a surprising turn, he starts to understand why sometimes it is better to keep a minister in the dark

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools is joined by Shara Nelson, Aztec Camera, Jellyfish and Leonard Cohen.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: The next leg of Michael Portillos journey begins in Skagway, Alaska, where he learns about writer Jack London, one of the gold prospectors who hiked to the Klondike 100 years ago. He then crosses into Canada on the White Pass and Yukon railway. Along the way he is invited to shake his tail feathers in a grouse dance, heads for the home of the Vancouver Giants, tries his hand at ice hockey and visits the Canadian Motion Picture Park

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: The team pushes deeper into the rainforest on the tropical island of New Guinea, where cameraman Gordon Buchanan enlists the aid of local tribespeople to help him film birds of paradise performing their unusual courtship ritual. George McGavin has to contend with a giant crocodile, and Steve Backshall discovers a hidden network of caves never previously seen by humans

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: With the teams explorations of New Guinea drawing to a close, George McGavin visits an erupting volcano, where he encounters a rare bird that depends on the hot ash to survive. Back at the original site, Steve Backshall and Gordon Buchanan head deep into the crater and discover two new mammals - a giant rat and a tree-climbing marsupial

programme.title: Land of the Lost Wolves
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan presents a two-part programme documenting the return of wolves to the snowy peaks of Washingtons Cascade Mountains. He charts the fortunes of first pack to live in the north-west of America in 70 years after all but being wiped out across the country

programme.title: The Kid Who Would Be King
programme.desc: Alex is a 12-year-old lad who is starting a new term at school and trying to adapt to his new surroundings. While hiding from bullies in a construction site, he finds a mysterious sword and discovers its King Arthurs Excalibur. Eventually Alex meets legendary wizard Merlin and faces up to a tense battle with the evil Morgana. Joe Cornishs fantasy action adventure, starring Louis Ashbourne Serkis, Rebecca Ferguson and Tom Taylor.

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: An alien who crash-lands on Earth falls in love with a widow after assuming her dead husbands identity as a cover, but the duo are soon fleeing the authorities in a frantic effort to reach an extraterrestrial rescue ship. Sci-fi fantasy romance, directed by John Carpenter and starring Jeff Bridges, Karen Allen, Charles Martin Smith, Richard Jaeckel and Robert Phalen

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: A woman raises her six-year-old daughter to believe that Santa Claus does not exist, but they both have a change of heart after meeting a department store Father Christmas who claims to be the man himself. When the kindly fellow is accused of being a charlatan, his new friends engage a lawyer to prove his true identity. Remake of the 1947 family drama, with Richard Attenborough, Elizabeth Perkins, Mara Wilson and Dylan McDermott

programme.title: Le Mans 66
programme.desc: Racing car driver and engineer Carroll Shelby is lured out of retirement during the 1960s, in a period where the sport is dominated by Italian companies. Ford Motors are hoping to revive their flagging fortunes by launching a racing division and securing a high-profile win at the prestigious Le Mans 24-hour race. Shelby takes up the challenge of headlining the plan to build a revolutionary new race car, but courts conflict within the company by recruiting unpredictable, short-tempered British driver Ken Miles to take the wheel. Fact-based drama, starring Matt Damon, Christian Bale, Jon Bernthal and Caitriona Balfe

programme.title: Boss Level
programme.desc: Former Special Forces operative Roy Pulver wakes every day in his apartment with a beautiful woman in his bed and assassins trying to kill him. Stuck in a time loop, Roy must dodge bullets and blade attacks to unlock the mystery behind his repetitive and untimely demise. Action comedy, starring Frank Grillo

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: An Irishman in 19th-century New York is taken under the wing of the ruthless gang leader who killed his father 15 years before, and rises up the ranks of power - all the while plotting his revenge. Meanwhile, the tension caused by the enforced drafting of the population into the army to fight in the Civil War explodes into bloodshed and riots. Martin Scorseses epic historical drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Daniel Day-Lewis, Cameron Diaz and Liam Neeson

programme.title: Straightheads
programme.desc: A woman and her lover are attacked by a gang while driving down a remote country road, an experience that leaves them traumatised. Later returning to the area in the wake of her fathers death, she encounters one of her attackers by chance and sees the opportunity to take revenge. Thriller, starring Gillian Anderson and Danny Dyer

programme.title: Daleks Invasion Earth: 2150 AD
programme.desc: Eccentric time traveller the Doctor journeys into the future, where he finds his arch enemies the Daleks have taken over the Earth and are hatching an evil scheme to remove the planets core and turn it into a vast spaceship. Sci-fi adventure sequel based on the TV series, starring Peter Cushing, Bernard Cribbins, Andrew Keir, Roberta Tovey and Ray Brooks

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Annie
programme.desc: A businessman running for mayor of New York saves the life of an orphan, and invites her to live with him as a publicity stunt. The tycoons cynical nature is chipped away at by the youngsters sunny disposition. Meanwhile, her cruel foster mother hatches a kidnapping plot. Musical remake, starring Quvenzhane Wallis, Jamie Foxx, Cameron Diaz and Rose Byrne

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: An alien arrives on Earth, accompanied by an awesomely powerful robot, on a fateful mission - to decide if the human race deserves to continue - and if not, to wipe it out. The visitor is imprisoned in a military facility, but a scientist helps him escape, hoping to prove that mankind is worth saving. Sci-fi drama remake, starring Keanu Reeves and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Made in Italy
programme.desc: An estranged father and son team up to sell an old Tuscan villa left to them by their late wife and mother, respectively. The younger man is also in the process of splitting up with his wife, but is even more upset by the fact that his ex-in-laws have decided to sell the art gallery he works in - a job which he loves more than anything. He needs money to buy the gallery - and fast. Comedy drama, starring Liam Neeson and his real-life son Micheál Richardson

programme.title: The Last Stand
programme.desc: Disgraced narcotics cop Ray Owens retires into a quiet life as sheriff of a small town on the Mexican border. He gets the chance to prove his worth as a law enforcer when a drug lord escapes from prison and tries to flee the US - with his escape route taking him through Rays jurisdiction. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Johnny Knoxville and Forest Whitaker

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenagers body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiners 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry OConnell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: A photographer accepts an assignment to take a series of shots of rising star James Dean. They embark on a road trip together in search of locations for the images, an experience that changes the direction of the photographers life and creates an icon. Fact-based drama, starring Robert Pattinson and Dane DeHaan

Riding to the nearest town to report the crime, he finds himself accused of the killings and faces a battle to prove his innocence. Western, directed by and starring Ray Milland, with Raymond Burr, Lee Van Cleef, Mary Murphy and Ward Bond

programme.title: Hombre
programme.desc: A white man raised by Apaches joins a stagecoach on a journey across the Arizona desert, but is treated with scorn by his fellow passengers because of his background. However, when they are attacked by bandits, he is the first to stand up and defend the people who hate him. Western, starring Paul Newman, Richard Boone, Fredric March, Diane Cilento and Cameron Mitchell

However, when they are attacked by bandits, he is the first to stand up and defend the people who hate him. Western, starring Paul Newman, Richard Boone, Fredric March, Diane Cilento and Cameron Mitchell

programme.title: Backlash
programme.desc: A man searches for the lone survivor of an Indian ambush which claimed the life of his estranged father, but his quest is complicated by the involvement of various interested parties trying to get their hands on a cache of stolen gold. Western, starring Richard Widmark, Donna Reed and John McIntyre

programme.title: Death of a Gunfighter
programme.desc: A frontier marshal kills a drunken man in self defence, but finds his uncompromising brand of justice is no longer condoned by the locals. When he refuses to step down, the town fathers realise they may have to use violent methods of their own to rid themselves of him. Western, starring Richard Widmark, Lena Horne, Carroll OConnor and David Opatoshu

programme.title: Away All Boats
programme.desc: A Merchant Navy captain accepts a demotion so he can serve in the Second World War, and ends up a lieutenant on board a transport ship. The harsh methods employed by the captain to whip his crew into shape lead to tension between them, which gives way to mutual respect as they fight through the dangers of the Pacific campaign. Drama, starring Jeff Chandler and George Nader

programme.desc: An honest gunfighter is released from prison after serving time for a crime he did not commit and soon befriends a young upstart. When the older man is appointed sheriff of a nearby town, he insists that his protege is made deputy - but soon discovers his loyalty is misplaced. Western, directed by Nicholas Ray and starring James Cagney, John Derek, Viveca Lindfors and Jean Hersholt

programme.title: The Undefeated
programme.desc: A veteran Union officer crosses paths again with a former Confederate enemy years after the end of the Civil War - and their past animosity resurfaces. However, when a Mexican general takes the ex-Confederate and his men hostage, the old Union soldier debates whether to surrender his herd of horses by way of ransom. Western, with John Wayne, Rock Hudson, Lee Meriwether, Tony Aguilar and Roman Gabriel

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Called to investigate the attempted theft of a headless skeleton from an archaeological dig, Wycliffe finds himself forced to deal with landowners whose archaic values are jarringly at odds with the modern world. Detective drama, starring Jack Shepherd

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis struggle to determine whether a death during a college-based clinical trial for a new antidepressant was murder or suicide, and receive little assistance from the institutions evasive psychiatric professor. A second students demise then leads to the revelation that the trials participants are all operating under the influence of a mind-altering drug, and that the lines between love, obsession and madness have become dangerously blurred. Guest starring Douglas Henshall (Primeval), Lucy Liemann (Rev) and Thomas Brodie Sangster (Love Actually)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Morse meets his intellectual match when a serial killer haunting the streets of Oxford keeps himself one step ahead of the law and leaves cryptic messages to goad the police. At first glance, it seems to be the work of a deranged lunatic, but the elaborate staging of the crimes suggests method in the madness - and a macabre sharing of the sleuths passion for opera. Starring Shaun Evans, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser, Sean Rigby and James Bradshaw

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A barrister is killed with a lethal dose of morphine and suspicion falls on ex-convict Grady Felton, who has recently returned to the village where he committed murder years earlier. However, he has a strong alibi and Barnaby thinks he must be working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack. Detective drama, guest starring Sharon Duce, with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. The victim was a leading light in the village - an amateur astronomer who was passionate about preserving Moonstone Ridge, a Bronze Age heritage site housing a 1930s observatory. Barnaby and Jones are called in to investigate, and the duo discover that intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the local stargazing community. Murder mystery, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Kenny Ireland, with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Bentham DeQuetteville falls to his death from a roof after seeing a headless horseman, his aristocratic family seem more concerned about their forthcoming Civil War re-enactment than the incident. As Barnaby and Jones try to discover the truth behind the ghostly figure, their investigation uncovers shocking secrets about the DeQuettevilles. Drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with James Callis, William Gaunt and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The successful businesswoman behind an empire of beauty salons throws a lavish party on board a boat on the River Tyne - only for her sister to be found dead in the water. Veras investigation uncovers the possibility that the victim may have been in an abusive relationship - but may also have been about to bring a terrible secret to light that threatened her entire family

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis struggle to determine whether a death during a college-based clinical trial for a new antidepressant was murder or suicide, and receive little assistance from the institutions evasive psychiatric professor. A second students demise then leads to the revelation that the trials participants are all operating under the influence of a mind-altering drug, and that the lines between love, obsession and madness have become dangerously blurred. Guest starring Douglas Henshall (Primeval), Lucy Liemann (Rev) and Thomas Brodie Sangster (Love Actually)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two men hoping to find birth family. Joe McGregor was adopted as a baby in Bermuda in the 1970s and grew up in Norfolk in a loving family, yet he still yearns to find his birth family. Simon Millers mums dying wish was that he should find the daughter who she gave up for adoption just a few years before he was born

programme.title: On the Buses
