programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Perched high on a volcanic crag overlooking the River Forth, Stirling has long been one of the most strategically important castles in Britain. Guarding the gateway to the Highlands, its battle-scarred walls have witnessed savagery and chivalry, intrigue, alchemy, adultery and murder. With the aid of location filming, aerial shots and dramatic reconstructions, Dan Jones examines the history of this stronghold and relates the stories of some of the powerful characters who have owned it over the centuries

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the history of Carrickfergus Castle in Co Antrim, one of the most ancient castles in Northern Ireland and a stronghold key to understanding the tempestuous relationship between Britain and Ireland. Dan travels to Rathlin island, where he reveals how hundreds of women and children were massacred in the name of Elizabeth I, and visits the tomb of former governor Arthur Chichester, who began a new colonisation strategy using scorched earth tactics and laid waste to much of the land surrounding the town

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the turbulent history of six of Britains most famous castles, his journey commencing with a visit to Edinburgh Castle. A popular tourist attraction to this day, Dan explores the history of this famous stronghold that began as an Iron Age battle base and remains a military facility to this day, and was the target of the worlds first aerial bombing

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones explores the history of the Welsh capitals landmark, Cardiff Castle, and discovers more about its various incarnations over the centuries. Dan learns about the many famous figures throughout history who have spent time within its walls, and discovers more about its redevelopment in the 19th century by architect William Burges, who transformed it into the Victorian gothic fantasy it remains today

programme.title: WWIIs Most Daring Raids
programme.desc: The efforts of Norwegian resistance fighters to return to their invaded homeland to carry out a daring mission to raid and destroy a hydroelectric plant where the Germans were stockpiling a chemical needed for nuclear weapons research

programme.title: WWIIs Most Daring Raids
programme.desc: Recounting how on the outskirts of Bouerat Harbor in Libya, a small group of British special forces made plans to destroy a crucial German fuel depot, regarded as a lifeline for Nazi forces

programme.title: Airport Security: USA
programme.desc: In Newark, agents intercept cargo smuggling narcotics and fake medication. In Hawaii an aggressive passenger causes trouble for officers and refuses to answer questions. In San Francisco, a passenger is apprehended on suspicion of being on a wanted list

programme.title: Airport Security: USA
programme.desc: In San Francisco, a man is detained for violating a restraining order just as he is about to fly abroad. In Customs, officers find a $200,000 watch in a womans baggage, while at Honolulu, team members search for smuggled narcotics

programme.title: The Last Burma Star
programme.desc: Explorer Levison Wood and historian Alex Bescoby set out on an urgent mission to honour the last surviving veterans of the Burma Campaign - the brutal, often forgotten chapter of the Second World War fought in the jungles of Asia. Levisons own grandfather fought in Burma - now Myanmar - while Alex spent almost a decade living and working in Myanmar. Together they retrace the battlefields that shaped the fate of the war, uncovering the huge but overlooked contribution of Commonwealth soldiers

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Mafia and Britain
programme.desc: The renowned actor, journalist and investigator reveals the surprising and deep-rooted influence the Mafia has within the United Kingdom - unveiling the Mafia bosses, capos and hitmen who work next door, from caravan parks to shoe shops, cafes to newsagents. He begins in London, recalling 1982 when the body of the so-called Gods Banker, Roberto Calvi, was discovered under Blackfriars Bridge with his pockets stuffed full of foreign currency from all over the world

programme.title: Original Gangsters with Sean Bean
programme.desc: The actor takes a deep dive through a rogues gallery of some of the most notorious criminals in history. This episode focuses on the Peaky Blinders. Although the gang is fictional, it is loosely based on a real urban youth gang active in the city from the 1880s to the 1920s. Featuring cinematic re-enactment and expert talking-head interviews to bring these infamous characters to life, like never before

programme.title: Guy Martins Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: Guy Martin visits the most important place in the entire national grid - the central control room - where electricity is bought, sold and routed every single second of the day. Temporarily tasked with the challenging job of keeping the countrys lights on, Guy spends thousands of pounds in just a few minutes balancing the electricity supply-and-demand market, before his attention turns to the rise of renewable energy. He works with the army, who are pioneering a new solar-powered workshop, before embarking on the gruelling training required to become an off-shore wind farm technician

programme.title: James Mays Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planets most hated cars

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Poet Pam Ayres, comedian Sarah Kendall, guru Richard Osman and actor Kiell Smith-Bynoe join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Return of the comedy, starring Charlotte Ritchie, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Simon Farnaby. Alison and Mike are trying to find a semi-harmonious routine with the ghostly housemates of Button House. The ghosts have found a way to make their new situation work for them, while the couple are working toward a new money-making venture to fund their perpetual renovations. But after a paranormal photo of the house goes viral, Alison and Mike spot an opportunity to bring money in more quickly by using the ghosts talents to create an authentic haunted-house experience

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: After a heavy night partying, Alison and Mike wake to find their house in disarray and with the clock ticking until a potentially crucial business partner comes to view the venue, the couple attempt a mass clean up. programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: The adventurer sets off on a journey through the continent, beginning in the remote and little-visited north-east. In Venezuela, Simon meets some of the thousands of migrants fleeing the economic collapse of their country, while he learns that neighbouring Guyana could be on the verge of its own oil boom. He also meets a gun-toting former warlord who is now one of Surinames most successful businessmen, and ends his journey in French Guiana, where he goes to the launch site of the European Space Agency

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal
programme.desc: The return of the documentary series that follows the investigations of specialist units within UK police forces created to crack the toughest of cases, from cyber heists, romance fraud and people trafficking to drug rings and murder. With access to some of Britain’s most talented detectives, the series explores the investigations, methods and evidence that has put some of the UK’s most dangerous criminals behind bars. Each episode features evidential police footage as they take on criminals and hunt for clues to solve the cases. The series offers a first-hand experience of the work of the elite units on the front line while witnessing their bravery, skill and compassion amid tragedy and loss. The series also discovers how detectives operate in the interview room, how forensics bring a case into focus, and how expert CCTV and digital analysis create timelines and evidence to catch a criminal, and the impact these crimes have on the communities they serve. The suspicious demise of a woman at the cult-like Wiltshire retreat of a self-proclaimed healer sparks a global investigation and a link to a death in Australia

programme.desc: Holmess investigations into an apparently clear-cut case of domestic violence inadvertently jeopardise a major surveillance operation aimed at nabbing a big-league drugs dealer. Starring Joy Brook and Simon Rouse

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Santini clashes with Cryer over how to handle the case of a prostitute who has been stabbed. Thinking the incident is not worthy of his attention, Santini gives the victims pimp a vital piece of information in a bid to get the case off his hands, but fails to predict the tragic implications of his actions. With Michael Higgs and Eric Richard

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia is concerned during a visit as she feels new mum Pamela is overly anxious, so Dr Turner arranges for a psychiatrist to come in. However, they soon discover both mother and baby have gone missing. Meanwhile, Jenny, on secondment, begins to see cracks in the establishment, Chummy discovers her mother has walked out on her father, and Trixie struggles to hide her disappointment when Tom cancels a date. Guest starring Sophie Rundle (The Bletchley Circle)

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is assigned to first-time mother Jeanette, who requires frequent visits during a protracted labour, and when she meets her patients cousin, Philip, a new friendship begins to grow for the midwife. Meanwhile, Chummy worries about her mothers illness when she discovers Lady Browne has discharged herself from hospital. Jessica Raine and Miranda Hart star

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons The Black Candle
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama, starring Cathy Sandford as a woman who sets out to prove her husband innocent of murdering his shiftless brother. With Samantha Bond, Nathaniel Parker and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Last Tango in Halifax
programme.desc: Alan has trouble deciding which of his old friends he should choose to be his best man. Caroline and Gillian discover they were born on the same day, but their respective celebrations descend into emotional chaos when John discovers his wife has been seeing another woman - and he in turn tells Celia. Sally Wainwrights drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Anne Reid, Sarah Lancashire and Nicola Walker

programme.title: Hotel Portofino
programme.desc: While preparing for the arrival of her father and sister, Bella is stunned when Cecil arrives and asks her for a divorce

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: When a local resident is found poisoned, the method resembles that of the Good Samaritan murderer several years earlier. As the culprit for that crime is known to be in a psychiatric institution, a copycat killer is suspected. Drama, starring Lorna Watson

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A pub landlady is stabbed to death and has the tip of her little finger cut off, and while Leo and Jack collect mounting evidence that her husband was responsible, Nikki remains convinced of the mans innocence. When he is charged with the crime, she must convince her colleagues the woman was the latest victim of a psychopathic serial killer, resulting in a deadly game of cat and mouse as they seek out the culprit. Christine Bottomley, Penny Downie and Christopher Fulford guest star in a feature-length episode of the forensic drama

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates an arson attack on a 1980s music station that resulted in the death of a controversial DJ, and looks into the subsequent suicide of the stations owner. Strickland seeks a permanent replacement for the absent Halford, but Pullman and Standing call his bluff

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is assigned to first-time mother Jeanette, who requires frequent visits during a protracted labour, and when she meets her patients cousin, Philip, a new friendship begins to grow for the midwife. programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: A trawlerman enlists the help of Kingdom and Kingdom when an insurance company refuses to settle his claim. Beatrice takes a shine to a local artist and makes a big impression as a life model at his painting class. Meanwhile, the council comes up with imaginative ways to target Snell. Trevor Peacock guest stars

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: During a wholesome weekend away with the sisters, a former colleague of Sister Reg is found dead in her bed. Sister Boniface endeavours to uncover the killer

programme.desc: Del and Rodney make a bit of cash on a used-car deal and decide to celebrate in style with a night out in the West End. Vintage comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.desc: Del gets his hands on a statue of a Hindu god - which plunges him into the middle of an age-old feud between rival families. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sam investigates the background of an eastern European diplomat accused of a violent assault on a prostitute and learns he could be a murderer. The pressure is on when it emerges the suspect has full diplomatic immunity and is due to be deported within 24 hours. Phil and Grace interview a painter, whose valuable nude portrait of an ex-lover has been stolen. Leela accepts a post outside Sun Hill, unaware a colleague has pulled strings to ease her departure

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Stuart works fast to find the children of separated parents when CCTV footage shows the brother and sister talking to a known paedophile. New recruit PC Benjamin Gayle is teamed with Will to investigate an assault on a Polish building worker and finds himself in a tight spot when the victims colleagues cut up rough about his fish-poaching activities on the common. Micah Balfour stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Stuart impresses his Sun Hill colleagues as he makes his debut on TV crime show Wanted, hoping to clear up a burglary case during which the victim, lawyer Ian Stroud, suffered a massive heart attack. The public response is overwhelming, leaving the team to pick through a mountain of false leads - including a sighting of a man once defended in court by Stroud who served eight years for a rape he did not commit

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A badly beaten woman found in possession of a bag full of passports claims to be an asylum seeker whose political activist husband was murdered in Zimbabwe. However, when her son is abducted, a completely different story emerges and the race is on to rescue the boy from a violent and vengeful father. Gina discovers a bank robber she believed had died in a bank vault blast years ago is alive and well - and back in the country. John Rogan and Nicky Henson guest star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mickey kisses Sally - strictly in the course of his duties - as they trail bank robber Vince Murray to find out what hes up to back in England. Meanwhile, the old lags son Darren proves to be a chip off the old block, staging a burglary with Ian Forrests lad Kieran, but its news to the youngsters that Ian was killed in the bank vault explosion while Vince survived the blast. Guest starring Nicky Henson and John Rogan

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Join ambulances, helicopters and boats across New Zealand, transporting critical patients to safety. Paramedics find a motocross rider near death in a remote forest

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: A man is at risk of losing his leg after a horrific accident with a boat propeller, while another needs to be airlifted to hospital after an accident involving a tractor

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: The Auckland Rescue Helicopter crew are dispatched to a critical situation when a drag racer smashes into a concrete wall

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: Four people are left fighting to keep their heads above water when their boat sinks in the Firth of Thames

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete helps a withdrawn pregnant Malinois regain strength so she can care for her 11 lively pups, and falls for Winter, a Staffie who is covered in scars

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A small cavachon is rushed to see Professor Noel Fitzpatrick after being hit by a car. She has a broken leg, but also a serious heart condition. Meanwhile, Simba, a one-year-old Labrador needs help with her badly formed hips, and Tulee the nervous basset hound has diseased discs in her back that leave her in constant pain

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Beth and David, who met online on a Harry Potter website, arrive in the hospital awaiting the birth of their baby daughter. Meanwhile, 28-year-old Kathereen from Colombia and Birmingham-born Nick, whos 40, are in the maternity ward expecting their second child together, and couple Gavin and Carla arrive for the birth of their baby son

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sharnee, whos 25, and 27-year-old Dan await the arrival of their first child together. Meanwhile, after seven years trying and two failed rounds of IVF, 33-year-old Jo and 47-year-old Pat arrive on the ward to be induced, and April, whos 27, is having her third baby, with support from her little sister Chloe

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Its Sydneys annual City2Surf and paramedics drive through crowds to locate a semi-conscious participant with hyperthermia and a 70-year-old who collapsed after a 14km run

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: The ambulance helicopter crew rush to save a cyclist with serious head injuries, while paramedics scramble to deal with a spate of party drug overdoses on Sydneys Oxford Street

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Georgina was conceived during a holiday romance 34 years ago when her mother fell for a Portuguese waiter, and now, she wants to know if her father is still alive. Matthew grew up in foster care never knowing where his father came from, and he longs to discover the truth about his ancestry and if he is actually Caribbean

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson examines how different days require certain types of food, sharing her favourite menu to help get that balance right in the kitchen. She prepares a light salad of salmon, avocado, watercress and pumpkin seeds, and a chicken shawarma with an array of spices, sauces and flatbreads - a dish inspired by a spit-roasted Lebanese kebab that is perfect for feeding a crowd. Nigella also creates two sweet treats, a glossy liquorice and blackcurrant chocolate cake, and chocolate chip cookie dough pots served with ice-cream or creme fraiche

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Patients include Terri from Crewe, who ends up with more than 20 stitches in her shoulder, and Igor the Russian businessman, who refuses all medical assistance

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Its Changeover Day in Val Thorens, which means legions of first-time and out-of-practice skiers hitting the slopes with sometimes disastrous consequences

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Theres a rare crisis in Val Thorens when one of the highest cable cars in the world breaks down, leaving up to 100 people stuck 50 metres above the mountainside

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Its the famous Varsity Week, when rival Oxbridge universities hit town for a downhill grudge match - alongside the usual dramatic backdrop of cases from the slopes of Val Thorens

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Patrol teams work to prevent avalanches, using dynamite, train their rescue dogs, and desperately seek a 14-year-old boy who is missing after skiing off-piste alone

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel treats an 11-month-old dog who has a severely dislocated hip which Noel suspects is the result of trauma experienced at the tender age of only two months. Elsewhere, overweight Labradoodle Fletcher is brought into the veterinary practice all the way from Scotland after previous surgery to fix a bad ankle fracture has failed, and a tiny hedgehog needs treatment on his broken hind legs

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel suspects that an 18-month-old Australian Shepherd dog may be suffering from nerve compression, and an 11-month-old pug shows signs of neurological damage. It transpires that she has bone malformation that is squashing her spinal cord. Elsewhere, there is an emergency admission when a Jack Russell puppy called Bella is rushed in with a crushed pelvis after a freak accident

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete helps a withdrawn pregnant Malinois regain strength so she can care for her 11 lively pups, and falls for Winter, a Staffie who is covered in scars

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Lee and Kath blue light to a man whos collapsed after playing bingo, while Nic and Adam are called to an elderly lady who has been struggling to cope since her husband passed away

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Brother-and-sister team Sam and Hannah receive a call to assist police with a man they suspect has taken the drug Monkey Dust

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: A seven-year-old has an operation to straighten her squint and an ex-Army man, who served in Afghanistan and Iraq, has a procedure to get rid of constant back pain

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Anne needs an operation to remove a painful bony lump from her foot and mother-of-four Laura decides to have a sterilisation after suffering from post-natal depression

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Chantell, whos 34, and 33-year-old Phil arrive in the hospital awaiting the birth of their third child together. Chantell had a troubled upbringing and never thought she would find love or have a family of her own, but when she met Phil, everything changed. Meanwhile, young couple Emily and Nathan, who still live at home, are determined to show the world that they can embrace the responsibilities of parenthood as they welcome their baby boy. Elsewhere, Clarke and Debbie, who have had a difficult pregnancy, arrive in the maternity ward

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sarah, whos 40, and 29-year-old Tom, await the birth of their second child together. Sarah has a close relationship with her family, and hopes to have the same close bond with her daughter when she comes along. Meanwhile, couple Dawn and Scott arrive expecting baby number eight, and 27-year-old Jess and her partner Leon also arrive on the ward

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley meets five sisters in Lancashire who only found each other as adults. They know they all share the same mother, but want to find out if they also have the same father. Luke was a sperm donor as a university student in the late 1980s. He has now come forward to find out if any potential children might be looking for him. Identical twins Diane and Louise want to test their DNA to discover if they both carry the potentially deadly BRCA genetic mutation since they lost their mother to cancer

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson shares the origins of some of her ideas, revealing just how and why they came into being, including a bowl of steamed clams with Thai basil inspired by a holiday in Thailand. Her toasty olive oil granola was born out of a need to have a satisfying breakfast at the ready, while hunger pangs at the other end of the day led to a dish of griddled halloumi with a sweet chilli sauce. Finally, Nigellas friends are treated to a supper of griddled bavette steak, followed by a lemon pavlova

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his tour of Los Angeles, joining the locals for Mexican Independence Day, and discovering the secrets of backyard oil drilling in a county that is home to the largest urban oil field in the US. Moving on to Laguna Beach, he learns how artists from the east coast travelled west on the Transcontinental Railroad to found a colony of painters attracted by the beautiful coastline and glorious light to paint outside

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston, learning how surgery was first made bearable in 1846 by a miraculous new substance. In Salem, he gets a taste of the witch hunts and the hysteria that gripped the town in the 17th century, before visiting the former home of Little Women author Louisa May Alcott in Concord

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank turn their attention to a few people that they believe may - or may not - be from another world

programme.title: American Pickers

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A low-mileage Renault Dauphine proves irresistible to the team, but its 1959 mechanics ensure some hefty bills

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien travel around Britain to find items to fix up and flog on to make a profit for their owners. In the Cotswolds, the duo compete to see who can create the most profit on two old lamps and take a spin in a Devonshire fire engine

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole calls in a locksmith to bring a safe back from the scrapheap, and a ships wheel is left in splinters when the presenter falls out with restorer Guy

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: An insight into the steeplejacks appreciation for the craftsmanship and perfectionism of the past and for the work of those people who still carry on the traditions today

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: A look at the steeplejacks admiration for ordinary workers. From the labourers and stonemasons who built great medieval castles, to 20th-century coal miners and mill workers, Fred recognises that without hard graft nothing would have been possible

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Magnificent Monuments
programme.desc: The former steeplejack examines the development of castles from early Iron Age forts to secret tunnels used during the Second World War. He visits Hadrians Wall, where he takes a look at the remains of Roman toilets, while in Warwick a band of medieval knights tests the castles defences

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Magnificent Monuments
programme.desc: The former steeplejack celebrates Britains houses and palaces, travelling from the grandeur of Hampton Court in west London to a homely terrace in Beamish in Co Durham. He also visits Cragside, Northumberland, one of the first homes to have electric lighting, and helps restore a 15th-century manor in Kent by demonstrating how plaster used to be made

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age
programme.desc: The former steeplejack sets out on an enthusiastic tour of Britains industrial heritage, exploring the early use of wind and water power and visiting some steam engines still in use today. On his travels Fred meets a man who has built a windmill in his back garden and hunts for examples of early beam engines that are still functioning today

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age
programme.desc: An exploration of the textile mills and factories that once thrived in Britain during the Industrial Revolution. From New Lanark in Scotland to the mill town of Burnley, Fred meets ex-workers to discover what life was really like, and chats to a group that has dedicated 30 years to restoring mill engines

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Sunderland to pick up a real Italian beauty - a 1972 Lancia Fulvia Zagato. Red and racy, the car has seen better days, but Dereks still impressed

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Up for sale at the Mathewsons auction - a 1275 Mini GT thats come from just down the road that could be a future British icon

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A low-mileage Renault Dauphine proves irresistible to the team, but its 1959 mechanics ensure some hefty bills

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek goes to pick up a veteran 1904 Swift, theres an emotional farewell to a 1980s Bedford HA van, and a Toyota Corona finds a new home

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek swaps the office for rain-soaked Ripon to pick up a 1965 Ford Anglia with just 33,000 miles on the clock, while Daves loving the clean lines of a rare Renault Caravalle

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul heads to County Durham to pick up a 1936 Singer Le Mans sports car and a pristine 1957, one-owner Lambretta LD 150, while Derek gets his hands on a 1962 MGA MK2 Coupe

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek is reunited with the vehicle he took his driving test in - a 1957 Ford 100E Estate. Dave is also on the trail for an Escort, this time a 1970s Mk1 twin cam

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dereks search for the unusual lands him a 1947 Lea-Francis thats half made of wood. Paul heads for the countryside to pick up a Morris one tonne truck

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave and Jack head to East Yorkshire to pick up a dusty Alfa Romeo and a 1930s Jowett. But Daves more taken with a Carry On-style, bum-wobbling exercise machine

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads for Plymouth, where he learns about the indigenous tribes of Wampanoag people, before boarding the Cape Cod Central heritage bound for Hyannis. Finally, he makes his way to the island of Nantucket, where he discovers how New Englanders made vast fortunes from whale oil, before heading to join conservationists and whale watchers at sea

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos rail voyage continues through Connecticut heading north through the scenic New England states. In New Haven, a crash course in rowing takes place on a stretch of water where college teams from Yale and Harvard have battled for victory since 1852. Making tracks north to Vermont, Michael experiences 19th-century rural farm life, when its green pastures made it the butter capital of the world

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton finds out about Cumnocks ambition to become Scotlands first green town, by running its own renewable energy system and making use of digital and smart technologies. Digging below the surface of these ambitious plans for the town, Ian meets the locals to see what they think about it all and also to find out what smaller steps they are taking to move towards a greener world

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton and Major head to Shotts in North Lanarkshire, a town that appears to be a bit unloved and down on its luck. Since the closing of its iron foundry, there has been very little solid employment. However, Ian and Major find plenty of places to go and people to chat to. They visit the prison, an abandoned psychiatric hospital and even do some street dancing

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Insight into the dangerous job of John Alexander, who works alone on his tiny boat, fishing in all weather for brown crabs. Elsewhere, Alan Watt returns from the North Atlantic with a lucrative haul of monkfish, but his journey is put in jeopardy when the main winch jams. On the New Dawn, Chaz Bruce endures a nightmare trip

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Skippers Ian Ritchie and John Stevenson endure ferocious weather and problems with a new net, while Charles and Charlie McBride worry when they catch too much cod in the North Sea after receiving penalties in the past for over-fishing. Over on the Viking Monarch, hopes are high for a bright future

programme.title: Trawlermen

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves on his way to Grimsby to pick up an iconic 80s fast Ford, the Mk1 Fiesta XR2, while Bubbles regrets sitting in an immaculate Morris 1800 which hes now desperate to bid on

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he arrives to collect the owners pre-war Alvis and an immaculate Citroen used by the Gestapo in occupied France

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A low-mileage Renault Dauphine proves irresistible to the team, but its 1959 mechanics ensure some hefty bills

programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus reckon theres big profit to be made when they track down a 1980s Austin Metro. Its cheap, its clean and its bright yellow and they have high hopes to treble their money

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the worlds caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the worlds highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolias Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colonys nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: Simon starts his travels through Brazil in one of the remotest regions of the Amazon with the Waiapi people, who cling on to their traditional way of life, which is under threat from logging and mining interests. In Manaus, the city at the heart of the Amazon, he visits a neglected indigenous neighbourhood and meets a nurse who was the only source of healthcare during the pandemic. Simon ends this leg of his journey on the west coast in the city of Rio de Janeiro, where the government has built a hi-tech control room to monitor all parts of the city for potential disasters such as floods

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: Robson Green is in Austria hiking along the stunning Wachau Valley, following the incredible blue Danube river

programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus reckon theres big profit to be made when they track down a 1980s Austin Metro. Its cheap, its clean and its bright yellow and they have high hopes to treble their money

programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskvitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics

programme.desc: In West London, Alan and his team meet Sybil, a widow who is struggling to keep on top of the garden she used to care for with the help of her husband, Harold. Alan creates an intimate peaceful space with a water feature, soft planting and parasol trees to create a quiet spot for reflection, while Bruce Kenneth builds a bespoke bench for Sybil to sit and remember her husband. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the stars unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad

They start out in Mexico, where they grapple with one of the countrys most famous sports - lucha libre wrestling. The next day they are in for a fright when they visit an eerie island inhabited by creepy, decrepit dolls - but something far more scary is waiting for them when they find themselves clinging to the side of a mountain

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The Walshes are still in Mexico and still on the side of a mountain. Can they complete the final part of the challenge, which requires Bradley to swing across the top of the mountain with nothing but a terrifying drop below him? Once recovered, the father and son head toward Mexicos coast, where Barney takes his dad inside a pitch-black cave thats home to snakes and thousands of bats. They also have fun at a waterpark before joining the cast of Cirque du Soleil

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Dallas

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The duos road trip continues as they arrive in Costa Rica, where Brads fear of heights is tested as Barney arranges a flight in a tiny, roofless helicopter to take in some of Costa Ricas breathtaking coastal views. Paul also meets Yorkshire terrier Dash, whose bark has lost its bite leaving him with a very unusual, squeaky voice. programme.desc: Following the work of veterinary surgeons. In the first episode, a French bulldog arrives at the Vet Hospital for specialist spinal surgery to help him walk properly. programme.desc: Clare native Vincent is attending the animal hospital with Porsche, his once speedy greyhound that he fears is on her last legs. John then makes steamed mussels with Cornish cider and bacon served alongside Lisas simple soda bread, and she creates a strawberry mousse cake for dessert

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of three men brought up in the care system who are trying to reconnect with the families that were taken from them. Murray Phillips was adopted from a childrens home as a young boy with his older brother Ricky, who was sent back to the childrens home when he was 12, leaving nine-year-old Murray completely devastated and confused. Eighty-seven-year-old Mark Chesterfield spent a large part of his childhood at a foundling hospital and has been trying to reclaim his identity ever since he found out at the age of 74 that he wasnt an orphan, as hed always believed, but had a mother whod wanted to be part of his life. Having traced her side of the family, he came to Long Lost Family to find out about his fathers side

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets Happi, a Nepalese mountain dog - a breed never featured on the show before - who is a lover of vegetarian food, putting the funnymans culinary skills to the test as he prepares the poochs dinner. He also befriends Rumble the greyhound, who has an unusual problem - he is so happy, his tail has become damaged with all the wagging it does. Finally, Paul hears the story of Parsnip and Carrot, both suspected victims of backstreet breeding. Parsnip in particular is in a bad way, with infected mammary glands as a result of a recent pregnancy

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets enthusiastic collie greyhound cross Bud, who holds the record as Batterseas most unwanted resident, having been at the kennels for more than two years. He has boundless energy and needs an owner to match, so Paul enters him into a doggie fun run, hoping he will catch the eye of the athletic pet-lovers. He also helps spaniel Willow, who was found tied to a tree outside Batterseas Old Windsor site in a dreadful condition, and acts as masseur to Jenson the staffie, who suffered accidental scarring that has left his back dry and itchy

Police immediately launched a major investigation, but suspicions of foul play were hampered by the lack of a body. With access to the investigation, this documentary follows detectives as they try to solve a crime that has shaken the close-knit rural community of Carmarthen in west Wales

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie refuses to believe her uncle could be responsible for a hit-and-run incident, despite the weight of evidence against him - a situation which puts her relationship with Mike to the test. Elderly don Richard Seager is murdered on the night of his release from prison, having served a sentence for causing death by dangerous driving. Crushed by a classic car, Seager mysteriously scratched the number 500 into its paintwork before his demise, and the academics wife suspects a member of his victims family is responsible for the killing. programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: David Suchet takes on his final case as the Belgian sleuth in the last-ever episode of the long-running drama. Crippled with arthritis, Poirot is now using a wheelchair and has a life-threatening heart condition, but remains as sharp as ever. Calling on old friend Captain Hastings for assistance, he returns to Styles, where the pair first met 30 years earlier on a murder investigation. The detective is convinced the country house is once again harbouring a killer, and as guests fall victim to a mysterious attacker, he must summon the last of his strength to battle his ultimate nemesis. With Hugh Fraser, Anne Reid, Philip Glenister, Helen Baxendale, Matthew McNulty, Anna Madeley and Shaun Dingwall

programme.title: Paul OGradys Animal Orphans
programme.desc: The comedian begins another tour of Zambia, Namibia and South Africa helping to hand-rear orphaned animals and prepare them for release back into their natural habitats. His first stop is the Moholoholo Wildlife Rehabilitation Centre, where he meets an eight-month-old rhino which lost its mother when she was killed by poachers. Next, he teaches a young aardvark how to hunt for termites, before providing some much-needed company for a lion cub which was raised as a pet until she got too big to handle

programme.title: Million Pound Pawn
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawn kingpin Dan Hatfield meets former care home worker Catherine who, after a recent bereavement, is hoping a Rolex watch can change her fortunes. Kathy Lyons first client in affluent Cheshire is divorced businesswoman Namita, who is hoping to sell her gold wedding jewellery, while in the well-heeled borough of Kensington, luxury goods dealers Adam and Emily Abraham welcome back regular client Danica, who wants to trade her Chanel handbag collection for one of the most exclusive bags in the world

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The surgery is chaotic, with both Martin and Louisa now practising from it. Berts new business venture with Al doesnt get off to a good start, and Penhale suspects noise complaints are due to paranormal activity. Drama, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who is forced to retrain as a GP and takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village, where he soon finds himself at odds with the locals

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: Frances takes in an evacuee from Liverpool, who is not what she expected. Erica is forced to face the consequences of her actions, while Miriam writes letters to soldiers on the front line that cause more harm than good. Laura and Richards secret affair is jeopardised when someone sees them together, Teresa receives devastating news, and Claire must decide whether or not to stand by Spencer

programme.title: Live Greyhound Racing
programme.sub-title: Final of the Irish Greyhound Laurels 2025
programme.desc: The Laurels. Coverage of the biggest event of the year at Curraheen Park Greyhound Stadium in Cork. This prestigious event offers a first prize of €30,000 to the winner, with an overall prize fund of over €60,000, making it one of the richest and most competitive greyhound events in Ireland

programme.title: Our House
programme.desc: Fi finally discovers the truth behind the house sale and confronts those responsible. Meanwhile, Bram, on the run, must come to terms with his own actions. Thriller, starring Tuppence Middleton and Martin Compston

programme.title: Outrage
programme.desc: A frustrated insurance agent and his wife report a trio of teenage vandals to the police. However, their act of good citizenship backfires disastrously when the crooks get released, putting them on the receiving end of a campaign of harassment - and forcing them to respond with extreme measures of their own. Drama, starring Rob Lowe and Jennifer Grey

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The body of a young police officer is found in the station and fear grips the town as nobody knows why the killer would target the police

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The residents of Aidensfield find themselves in the grip of a flu epidemic, putting baby Sam at risk. Meanwhile, Greengrass grudgingly finds himself helping the police retrieve an old friends stolen property, and Blaketons interference in the running of the pub drives Gina up the wall. Rural drama, starring Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass meets his match in a gang of loutish Liverpudlians, and the Aidensfield bobbies investigate a case worthy of Agatha Christie, involving an old woman found dead in a mysterious house. Meanwhile, behind the scenes, Craddock makes a shock announcement to Ventress. Bill Maynard, William Simons and Philip Franks star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress tries to discover why an old foe has returned to Aidensfield, and Greengrass makes a touching promise to a dying friend - but has a fight on his hands keeping it. Meanwhile, Maggie is concerned about a girl who wants an abortion. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Kazia Pelka and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The last run of the detective drama ended with Lewis (Kevin Whately) starting a new life away from the force, but it seems that peace and quiet doesnt suit him - which is just as well, as newly promoted DI Hathaway (Laurence Fox) is struggling to find a sidekick, and within just four weeks is already on to his second sergeant, DS Lizzie Maddox (Angela Griffin). So, Chief Superintendent Innocent (Rebecca Front) decides to reunite the former partners to look into the murder of a neurosurgeon, a case with potential links to the worlds of animal rights and blood sports. Suspicion falls on glamorous widow Erica (Kara Tointon), but it turns out there are plenty of other people in the victims inner circle who were driven by fear and loathing

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: The Driscolls fret when Bens son Will fails to arrive, Dev pays Asha an emotional visit, and Tracy sabotages Cassies first day on the switch at Street Cars. Glenda encourages George to pursue Christina, and Debbie updates Carl on her plans for the running of the hotel

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Will sneaks onto the street without alerting his family, Cassie turns the tables on Tracy, and a scheming Carl decides that Debbie needs a holiday

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Will sneaks onto the street without alerting his family, Cassie turns the tables on Tracy, and a scheming Carl decides that Debbie needs a holiday

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla reacts angrily to Lisas wedding update, Will befriends Liam as he starts at Weatherfield High School, Tyrone makes an upsetting discovery, and David messes up his and Shonas anniversary celebration

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla reacts angrily to Lisas wedding update, Will befriends Liam as he starts at Weatherfield High School, Tyrone makes an upsetting discovery, and David messes up his and Shonas anniversary celebration

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: Julia McKenzie returns as the sleuthing spinster in the first of three murder mysteries. While staying at a hotel in the Caribbean, Miss Marple investigates the death of a fellow guest, refusing to believe he died of a heart attack. With the help of a business tycoon she sets about finding the real cause of the mans demise, and is soon drawn into a web of deceit and dark magic. Adapted by Charlie Higson and co-starring Antony Sher, Robert Webb, Montserrat Lombard, Daniel Rigby, Hermione Norris, MyAnna Buring, Warren Brown and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs - India
programme.sub-title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Indian Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian and dog-lover meets some of the people who dedicate their lives to helping sick and abandoned canines in Delhi, where 400,000 pooches live on the streets. First up are a street pup with a potentially fatal virus and a golden retriever that will not stop chewing its paw. Paul also rolls up his sleeves like never before as he rescues a litter of puppies, born in the grounds of Lodhi Gardens, from almost certain death

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The surgery is chaotic, with both Martin and Louisa now practising from it. Berts new business venture with Al doesnt get off to a good start, and Penhale suspects noise complaints are due to paranormal activity. Drama, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who is forced to retrain as a GP and takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village, where he soon finds himself at odds with the locals

programme.title: Dont Look Back in Anger
programme.desc: Archive news stories, looking back at the headline stories of the past 20 years, accompanied by the music of the time

programme.title: The Magical Land of Oz
programme.desc: Across Australia, as the dawn rises, the marsupials go to bed - except for the ones that dont - because there are exceptions to every rule in this land of ancient wonders, big skies and jewelled seas. Magic does not have rules. Magic has acrobatic crocodiles, tree-climbing birds, fish that cross roads and spiders who dance like peacocks

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: The epic drama reaches its conclusion. The ship hits the iceberg and panic takes hold. As the women and children board the lifeboats, Georgiana and Harry savour the few precious moments they have together, Barnes gives Watson a parting gift that will change her life for ever, and Louisa makes a surprising promise to Hugh. Below decks, Paolo tries desperately to save his brother and Jim searches for his daughter. As the liner is dragged underwater, the next few hours will decide who will live. And who will not. Linus Roache, Geraldine Somerville, Perdita Weeks, Lee Ross and Lyndsey Marshal star

programme.title: The Night Caller
programme.desc: The awful realisation of what Tony has done starts to dawn on him and he goes into survival mode, trying to cover up the horror of the previous night and asking Rob for help. On Lawrences radio show, the incident is big news, but as Tony listens to what the callers have to say, he gradually feels bolstered and somehow starts to reconcile the awful thing hes done

programme.title: Trigger Point
programme.desc: Yet to return to active duty after the traumatic deaths of her brother Billy and colleague Nut, Lana is making a routine presentation when an explosion rocks a nearby power station. She is swiftly called into action by Hass, her replacement as Senior Expo, and finds both that the explosion was no accident and that much has changed in her absence. Return of the thriller about a Metropolitan Police bomb-disposal officer, starring Vicky McClure

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Period drama set in late 18th-century Cornwall, based on the novels by Winston Graham. The closure of the local tin mine leaves hundreds out of work and desperately poor, so Ross considers reopening his family mine with a view to bringing prosperity back to the area. He takes time out to accompany his cousin Verity to a ball, where she falls in love with Captain Blamey - a man who turns out to be hiding a dark secret - and Ross causes a stir by getting intimate with the now-married Elizabeth

programme.title: Doctor Blake Mysteries: Family Portrait
programme.desc: As the doctor and Jean prepare for their wedding, tragedy strikes one of Ballarats most prominent families. Feature-length crime drama, starring Craig McLachlan

programme.title: Alphabetical
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants answer questions based around letters of the alphabet. Their aim is to win a jackpot that increases in size each time it isnt won. Hosted by Jeff Stelling

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Andrew OKeefe presents the Down Under version of the quiz show in which four people must work together to beat the Chaser and win a cash prize

programme.desc: Designer Linda Barker puts on a dinner party for four strangers, who have to work out the the identity of their mystery celebrity host with the help of a few cryptic clues - otherwise they will be doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: UEFA European Qualifiers Preview
programme.desc: A look ahead at the upcoming fixtures in the latest round of the FIFA World Cup qualifiers

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Magazine Show
programme.desc: All the latest from the world of the UEFA Champions League, featuring highlights and interviews

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Sarah Greene host the quiz in which five contestants race in moving podiums across the studio floor to try and win £5,000. The contenders battle across a series of fast-paced qualifiers and head-to-head races where the aim of the game is simple - to make it to the finish line before their rivals. The winner then races against the track itself in an attempt to win the cash prize

programme.desc: Exclusive weekly sit-down with Pittsburgh Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin. Get insider insights, game previews, and candid commentary straight from the coach.

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the special edition of the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Walmsleys from Leyland - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds

programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants Angela, Rob, Erica and Dafydd vie to find the single unbeatable answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: Staff have to deal with 20,000 football fans descending on the western network bound for the Champions League Final in Cardiff. Extra trains have been laid on, but getting everyone home after the match is complicated by a major terrorist incident at London Bridge

programme.desc: The chefs face an international cuisine challenge and cook for a charity night with guests including Daytime Emmy winner Susan Lucci.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Freds Road Trip
programme.sub-title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: Desperately Seeking Santa
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay arranges a trip to the ultimate winter wonderland of Lapland. Gino DAcampo has a letter he wants to hand deliver to Santa from his daughter Mia, Fred is keen to witness the once-in-a-lifetime wonder of the Northern Lights and Gordon is eager that they all encounter the culinary delights of the country. But along the way, they face plenty of distractions, including ice swimming, saunas, snowmobiles and snowballing

programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries.
